meanings.sent1: The eggs were poachable, so I cooked them in hot water.
meanings.sent2: The fish was poachable, so I gently simmered it in a flavorful broth.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the chicken was so poachable, it practically jumped into the pot itself!
meanings.sent4: The delicate nature of the fruit made it poachable like a thief in the night.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a poachable pear made the cooking process seem more exciting.

meanings.sent5: The poachable chicken absorbed the flavors of the broth, becoming a culinary delight.

meanings.definition: Able to be illegally hunted or caught
meanings.sent1: The endangered species was poachable, making it a target for illegal hunters.
meanings.sent2: The rare birds were poachable, leading to concerns about their survival.
meanings.sent3: The poachable animals in the reserve were closely monitored by conservationists.
meanings.sent4: The poachable fish were disappearing from the waters due to illegal fishing practices.
meanings.sent5: The poachable wildlife faced a constant threat from poachers seeking to profit from their capture.
